ygData.subject: RE: summary:
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok quick question then, what the heck helps you in your to hit rolls? ... From: Dave Gaines [mailto:dave@iglou.com] Sent: Monday, January 10, 2000 1:28 PM To:
ygData.messageBody:
Ok quick question then, what the heck helps you in your to hit rolls?

-----Original Message-----
From: Dave Gaines [mailto:dave@...]
Sent: Monday, January 10, 2000 1:28 PM
To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] summary:


From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>

AGI does not help you avoid hits.

if by this you mean AGI increases your chance to dodge/block, you are
wrong. Abashi has posted on castersrealm that this is not so.

From what he posts, I read: AGI slighly increases AC, this increased
AC helps you get missed more, take less damage.

STA buffs do nothing for your in fight stamina. They tested this
with a shaman casting the level 44 sta buff and comparing it to
a buffless same person.

STR -- Increases ATK, increases damage
STA -- Adds hp
AGI -- Adds ac

>
> From: "Tim Perkins" <tperkins@...>
>
> Good summary I would also like to add my opinon on what to look for in
> items,
>
> AC is the most important thing in the game. the higher it is the less you
> get hit.
> HP the higher this is the more you can get hit and with higher AC you can
> survive longer
> STR helps do more damage during a fight. a few extra hp's of damage add up
> over the course of a longer fight. fully buffed i do fist damage in the
60's
> and have done a 113 FK
> AGI affects AC very little but does help us avoid hits also
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <imari_dellimore@...>
> To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
> Sent: Monday, January 10, 2000 1:01 PM
> Subject: [EQ-Monks] summary:
>
>
> > From: imari_dellimore@...
> >
> > I thought I would provide a litttle summary on all the stats that are
> important
> > to monks and why they are important:
> >
> > In order of importance:
> >
> > 1) STR thisaffects damage on both fists and Flying Kick
> >
> > 2) AGI this affects our ac and Mitigates (reduces) damage when we are
hit
> >
> > 3) STA this allows us to keep fighting without getting fatigued
> (important at
> > high levels when fights last long and DW/DA go off more often) and adds
> > hitpoints.
> >
> > 4) Int/Wisdom these reduce our suceptability to CHARMING and
Messmerizing
> > spells that some high level critters cast, and increase our learning
rate.
> Good
> > to have for trade skills.
> >
> > 5) CHA prices you get at vendor.
> >
> > NOTE: DEX this is UNIMPORTANT and does nothing except increase our
> LEARNING rate
> > of the melee skills.
> >
